title: Hawaii
indexDescription: In January Steve, Kathleen and Elisabeth vacationed in Hawaii.
description: Steve, Kathleen and Elisabeth vacationed in Hawaii January 19-26, 2025.

images.description: We stayed in a two-bedroom condominium in Kihei, Maui, with our unit located on the top (third) floor. This photo was taken from our balcony in the early morning of our first day.

Elisabeth and Steve enjoying their morning coffee on the lanai, with the island of Lāna‘i visible in the upper right and Kaho‘olawe hidden to the left. We spotted whales offshore, and later, after Kathleen joined us, we had a lively voice conversation with ChatGPT — our virtual whale expert — that was entertaining.

The beach in front was shallow and we spent a lot of time playing in it.  Once you get deep enough you can jump the waves.  We learned how to recognize and avoid the rocks.  

We looked up a good swimming beach near us and made a trip there.  It had a nice sandy bottom and the water got deep quickly -- perfect for swimming.

We watched these two guys fishing in the serf in front of our place. They were wearing long sleeve clothes for sun protection.  They are standing on aluminum step ladders.  They would fish a while at one location then pick up the ladders and wade up the beach to their next location.  We estimated they fished for about 6 hours.  We saw them another day too.

We visited the Grand Wailea for dinner, entering from the upper level of the resort. This photo captures the stunning view from the lobby, looking down across the cascading terraces and pools. Our restaurant was located at ocean level to the right, offering breathtaking views and a memorable meal.
Elisabeth and sunset at the Gran Wailea.

We took a trip up the valley road from Kahului to visit Kepaniwai Park — a place that left a lasting impression on our last visit to Maui, when we stopped by while waiting for our flight home. The park is threaded with small freshwater ditches filled with familiar aquarium fish like swordtails, guppies, and orange platies, just like the ones I had growing up. Families were barbecuing, chickens wandered freely, and the landscape was lush with full-size Cook pines, a sprawling banyan tree, and clusters of bananas.
Steve looking at the big Banyan tree in Kepaniwai park.
Elisabeth and Kathleen in front of a Banyan tree in Kepaniwai Park.
There were a group of people saying at the a ground floor room at the condominium that had the sunset ritual of blowing conch shells.

We walked the nice 3 mile round trip beach trail in Wailea.  It's in front of the fancy luxury hotels.  The trail is like walking through a botanical garden.  It's mostly rocky beach with the occasional sand beaches.  We saw some giant turtles.  We meet a nice hotel worker riding a golf cart that invited us up to tour the hotel pools with slides and the outside grass roofed bar huts and aquarium.

Another trip inland to the Hāliʻimaile General Store.  We have fond memories from a previous trip where the kids had blue colored mock cocktails with umbrellas and swords. This time is was raining like crazy.  We had a nice meal but without the blue drinks.

I took a long late afternoon walk up the beach as far as I go, then transitioned to residential streets.  I noticed that the fancy houses had unique artistic gates.  I took 22 pictures of them but I was disappointed with the late sun in the background. Next time I'll do it in the morning.
I walked up the beach one afternoon and found a big group of people launching two outrigger canoes.
We took a trip inland to a Ocean Organic Vodka distillery. They have a field with picnic tables.  There was a band playing and you could order cocktails and food.  We were there for the sunset.
Selfie at Ocean Organic Vodka distillery at sunset.
